snippet: After limiting a privilege to dismiss lawsuits in the name of national security, the attorney general has intervened in a defamation case against United Against Nuclear Iran.
abstract: Attorney Gen Eric H Holder Jr, during his first year in office, put new limits on when government can dismiss lawsuits in name of protecting national security; Holder has now broad authority to do just that, intervening in defamation lawsuit against United Against Nuclear Iran, advocacy group pushing for tough sanctions against Tehran; government says case should be dropped because opening files will jeopardize national security.
lead_paragraph: After limiting a privilege to dismiss lawsuits in the name of national security, the attorney general has intervened in a defamation case against United Against Nuclear Iran.

headline.main: Holder Says Private Suit Risks State Secrets
headline.print_headline: Holder Says Private Suit Risks State Secrets
